headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Access token authorized by a TikTok Creator Marketplace account or TTO Creator Marketplace account. For details, see Authentication .

parameters.name: video_id
parameters.description: ID of the video that is created under the creator account. The video needs to meet any of the following requirements: The video has been uploaded and tagged as branded content, and the creator has linked the video to a TTCM order via the invite link ( invite_link ) or campaign code ( campaign_code ) created via /tcm/order/create/v2/ . You can get video_id via /tcm/order/get/v2/ or /tcm/report/get/v2/ . The video has been uploaded and tagged as branded content, and the creator has linked the video to a TTO Creator Marketplace campaign via the invite link ( invite_link ) created via /tto/tcm/campaign/create/ . You can get video_id via /tto/tcm/campaign/ or /tto/tcm/report/ .

parameters.name: tcm_account_id
parameters.description: TikTok Creator Marketplace account ID or the ID of the TTO Creator Marketplace account. To obtain the IDs of the TTO Creator Marketplace accounts that you can access via Access-Token , use /tto/oauth2/tcm/ .

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: The return code. For the complete list of error codes and descriptions, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: The return message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

fields.name: auth_status
fields.description: The status of the authorization. Enum values: WAITING : The creator has not rejected or approved your request for authorization. The creator will receive a notification on their TikTok app regarding your request and can approve or reject it through the System Notification page within the app. Even if the creator has enabled "Ad authorization" in the "Branded content and ad" settings, the auth_status will remain WAITING until the creator approves your request. However, in this case, you can receive an auth_code that can be used to grant video authorization to an advertiser account. REJECTED : The creator has rejected your request for authorization. ACCEPTED : The creator has approved your request for authorization.

fields.name: auth_status_updated_time
fields.description: The time when auth_status was last updated. For example, when auth_status changed from WAITING to ACCEPTED .

fields.name: num_remaining_request
fields.description: Returned only for videos linked to TTCM orders. The number of times left for you to request Spark Ads authorization. You have 30 times left at most to request authorization before the request is approved or rejected.

fields.name: requested_authorization_days
fields.description: The validity period (in days) that you request for spark ads authorization or the new validity period you want to update for the approved authorization. Enum values: 7 , 30 , 60 , 365 . Default value: 30 . Note : The actual validity period ( auth_code_end_time - auth_code_start_time ) can be different from the validity period you request, because the creator can choose any validity period ( 7 ， 30 ， 60 ， 365 ) when approving the request.

fields.name: auth_code
fields.description: Returned only when auth_status is ACCEPTED . Authorization code to boost the video in the order.

fields.name: auth_code_start_time
fields.description: Returned only when auth_status is ACCEPTED . The UTC+0 date and time when the authorization code becomes valid.

fields.name: auth_code_end_time
fields.description: Returned only when auth_status is ACCEPTED . UTC+0 date and time when the authorization code expires.

fields.name: auth_code_status
fields.description: Returned only when auth_status is ACCEPTED . The status of the authorization code. Enum values: NOT_USED : The authorization code has been generated but has not been used yet. IN_USE : The authorization code has been generated and is in use now. EXPIRED : The authorization code has been generated and has expired. DELETED : The authorization code has been deleted.
